meanings.definition: Lift or carry (a heavy object) with effort.
meanings.sent1: She was hefting the box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: Hefting the groceries into the car, she felt her muscles strain.
meanings.sent3: The little dog tried hefting the huge bone, but it was comically too heavy for him.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it was hefting a burden too heavy to bear.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the world seemed to be hefting down on her shoulders.

meanings.definition: The act of lifting or carrying something heavy.
meanings.sent1: His hefting of the boulder impressed everyone at the competition.
meanings.sent2: The hefting of the bags of cement left his arms sore.
meanings.sent3: The hefting of the giant pumpkin at the fair was a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The hefting of responsibility onto his young shoulders was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The hefting of the treasure chest revealed its hidden contents.
